Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2009 10:12PM ps123 wrote: Debbie, I also had neoadjuvant chemo and had to be fully expanded before rads.  The expansion just had to be done quicker than usual. My ps just did larger fills once a week. My ps initially put in 100 cc's during surgery then I started my fills a couple weeks after the surgery. I'm only a "B" though so only had 3 (or 4...can't remember) fills.  I think they like to have you fully expanded before rads because your skin/muscle doesn't always expand as well after rads. Pat
Posts.Title: What's your opinion on post-treatment tests staceyshusband bettysgirl

Posts.Content: ps123 wrote: Ok, I'm probably worrying for nothing and it will be gone by tomorrow but has anyone ever had red splotches suddenly come up on their lymphedema arm? I woke up this morning and my hand (which is my problem area) was a little sore and a little more swollen than usual. I didn't think much about it and just put my glove on as usual (I don't usually need the sleeve unless doing something active w/arm). Then I noticed couple of times during the day my arm was a little sore. When I finally looked at it this afternoon I saw what kind of looked like a light red bruise and then noticed there were more. A few tiny spots look kind of like some sort of bug bite, although I don't think it is, and the other spots look like light red bruises. Another reason for concern is I'm flying to Texas for vacation on Tuesday and if it's an issue w/the lymphedema I need it resolved by then so I can use my compression sleeve and glove to fly. I guess I should call someone tomorrow if it's still there, but in the meantime thought I'd check here for any insight you might have. Thanks, Pat Log in to post a reply
